section: Parbhati - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Prabhaatee, The Word Of Devotee Baynee Jee:

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

section: Parbhati - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru:

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

section: Parbhati - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: You rub your body with sandalwood oil, and place basil leaves on your forehead.

melody.description: The emotions conveyed in Parbhati are those of extreme devotion; there is an intense confidence and love for the entity it is devoted to. This affection arises from knowledge, common sense and a detailed study. There is therefore an understanding and a considered will to devote itself to that entity.

author.author: Saint Beni
author.description:
Saint Beni [15th - 16th Century] was a Hindu mystic whose teachings have been incorporated in the Guru Granth Sahib. It is believed he spent most of his time in prayer and meditation, and often neglected his household needs - so God himself intervened and physically appeared to help him several times.

Saint Beni has three hymns in the Guru Granth Sahib marked by an intense spiritual longing. They also indicate the various paths tried by him in his quest, his practical experience of life and his mastery of religious lore of diverse traditions.

section: Parbhati - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: But you hold a knife in the hand of your heart.

translation.text: You look like a thug; pretending to meditate, you pose like a crane.

translation.text: You try to look like a Vaishnaav, but the breath of life escapes through your mouth. ||1||

text: ਕ੍ਰੂਰ ਦਿਸਟਿ ਰਤਾ ਨਿਸਿ ਬਾਦੰ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥
section: Parbhati - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: But your gaze is evil, and your nights are wasted in conflict. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: krūr disat ratā nis bādan .1. rahāu .
